com.mycalendar.time_and_date

Class DatePickerFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.app.Fragment
      • android.app.DialogFragment
        • com.mycalendar.time_and_date.DatePickerFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.app.DatePickerDialog.OnDateSetListener, android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.content.DialogInterface.OnCancelListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener

    public class DatePickerFragment
extends android.app.DialogFragment
implements android.app.DatePickerDialog.OnDateSetListener
    This class create and manage the date picker dialog for an event.
    Author:
    Luca Bellettati

      • onCreateDialog

        public android.app.Dialog onCreateDialog(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        It creates the dialog according to the button pressed.
        Overrides:
        onCreateDialog in class android.app.DialogFragment

      • onDateSet

        public void onDateSet(android.widget.DatePicker view,
             int year,
             int monthOfYear,
             int dayOfMonth)
        It is called when the set button in the dialog is pressed. The data received from the dialog are used to update the value of the date and of the button text. If a date occurring before the current day is set a warning message is shown and no changes are performed.
        Specified by:
        onDateSet in interface android.app.DatePickerDialog.OnDateSetListener

      • setButtonManager

        public void setButtonManager(TimeButtonManager manager,
                    android.content.Context ctx)
        It sets some parents objects used during the dialog work flow.
        Parameters:
        parent - the current EventCreate instance where the dialog is used
        ctx - the current context
